thread.title_full: Oscars 2017: Emma Stone admits THAT mix-up was 'one of most horrible moments of her life’ | Celebrity News | Showbiz & TV | Express.co.uk

author: Jessica Earnshaw
title: Oscars 2017: Emma Stone admits THAT mix-up was 'one of most horrible moments of her life’ | Celebrity News | Showbiz & TV | Express.co.uk
text:
It was just so horrible! Emma Stone 
"I f love Moonlight. God I love Moonlight so much. I'm so excited for Moonlight," Emma said backstage. 
The film star continued: "Of course it was an amazing thing to hear La La Land, I think we would have all loved to have won best picture. 
"But we're so excited for Moonlight. I think it's one of the best films of all time. I also was holding my best actress in a leading role card that entire time." GETTY Oscars 2017: Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway announced the wrong winner GETTY Oscars 2017: It was Brian Cullinan that handed out the wrong envelope 
Emma went on: "I don't mean to start stuff but whatever story that was - I had that card. So I'm not sure what happened. Is that the craziest Oscars of all time? Cool. We made history tonight. Craziest moment." 
PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), the accountancy firm who counts the thousands of ballots cast by members of the Academy, have accepted full responsibly for the terrible mistake and revealed who was behind it. 
Two accountants were hired to safeguard the Oscar 2017 winners at the awards ceremony, Brian Cullinan and Martha Ruiz. The former handed the back-up envelope for Actress in a Leading Role to Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway. Related articles
